headline.print_headline: Hoeness Quits Bayern, Accepts Jail Term for Tax Evasion
headline.main: Hoeness Quits Bayern, Accepts Jail Term for Tax Evasion

docs.snippet: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros (22.5 million pounds) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful footb...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros (22.5 million pounds) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful football dynasties.

docs.snippet: Crimean residents hoping for a better life are looking forward to weekend referendum and reunion with Russia. Deborah Lutterbeck reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: Crimean residents hoping for a better life are looking forward to weekend referendum and reunion with Russia. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

headline.print_headline: Crimea Vote to Keep Markets on Edge
headline.main: Crimea Vote to Keep Markets on Edge

docs.snippet: Investors will start the week early as the Sunday referendum to decide if Crimea becomes part of Russia or remains Ukrainian will likely reverberate in markets worldwide....
docs.lead_paragraph: Investors will start the week early as the Sunday referendum to decide if Crimea becomes part of Russia or remains Ukrainian will likely reverberate in markets worldwide.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Aims to Shed Control of Internet Addresses
headline.main: U.S. Government Aims to Shed Control of Internet Addresses

docs.snippet: The U.S. government announced on Friday it will give up its most direct means of control over the Internet's infrastructure, but said it will insist that the job be taken on by a group that includes the private sector and other interested parties,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government announced on Friday it will give up its most direct means of control over the Internet's infrastructure, but said it will insist that the job be taken on by a group that includes the private sector and other interested parties, not just multiple governments.

headline.print_headline: California Pension Reform Measure Abandoned After Court Ruling
headline.main: California Pension Reform Measure Abandoned After Court Ruling

docs.snippet: Backers of a ballot measure to cut California's public pensions, which was seen as a model for other states, abandoned their campaign to win voter support on Friday after a court ruling....
docs.lead_paragraph: Backers of a ballot measure to cut California's public pensions, which was seen as a model for other states, abandoned their campaign to win voter support on Friday after a court ruling.

headline.print_headline: Suspect in Deadly South By Southwest Crash Charged
headline.main: Suspect in Deadly South By Southwest Crash Charged

docs.snippet: The drunken-driving suspect who police say killed two people after he smashed his car through a street barricade at the South By Southwest festival did not use his brakes and even accelerated as he approached crowds, according to an arrest warrant...
docs.lead_paragraph: The drunken-driving suspect who police say killed two people after he smashed his car through a street barricade at the South By Southwest festival did not use his brakes and even accelerated as he approached crowds, according to an arrest warrant released Friday.

headline.print_headline: Sandwich Chain Quiznos Files for Bankruptcy Protection
headline.main: Sandwich Chain Quiznos Files for Bankruptcy Protection

docs.snippet: Sandwich chain Quiznos Corp filed for pre-packaged bankruptcy protection on Friday after struggling for years with high debt and rising competition....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sandwich chain Quiznos Corp filed for pre-packaged bankruptcy protection on Friday after struggling for years with high debt and rising competition.

headline.print_headline: Mexico's Inbursa Buys Standard Bank's Brazil Unit for $45 Million
headline.main: Mexico's Inbursa Buys Standard Bank's Brazil Unit for $45 Million

docs.snippet: Mexican bank Grupo Financiero Inbursa <GFINBURO.MX> on Friday said it agreed to buy the Brazilian unit of South Africa's Standard Bank for $45 million (27 million pounds), marking its first foray outside of Mexico....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexican bank Grupo Financiero Inbursa <GFINBURO.MX> on Friday said it agreed to buy the Brazilian unit of South Africa's Standard Bank for $45 million (27 million pounds), marking its first foray outside of Mexico.
